column6: -NoLabel', minLevel, maxLevel ) yield path - expand from start node following the given relationships from min to max-level adhering to the label filters

column3: list, {minLevel,maxLevel,uniqueness,relationshipFilter,labelFilter,uniqueness:'RELATIONSHIP_PATH',bfs:true, filterStartNode:false, limit:-1, optional:false, endNodes:[], terminatorNodes:[], sequence, beginSequenceAtStart:true}) yield path - expand from start node following the given relationships from min to max-level adhering to the label filters.

list, {maxLevel,relationshipFilter,labelFilter,bfs:true, filterStartNode:false, limit:-1, optional:false, endNodes:[], terminatorNodes:[], sequence, beginSequenceAtStart:true}) yield path - expand a spanning tree reachable from start node following relationships to max-level adhering to the label filters

list, {maxLevel,relationshipFilter,labelFilter,bfs:true, filterStartNode:false, limit:-1, endNodes:[], terminatorNodes:[], sequence, beginSequenceAtStart:true}) yield nodes, relationships - expand the subgraph reachable from start node following relationships to max-level adhering to the label filters, and also return all relationships within the subgraph

list, {maxLevel,relationshipFilter,labelFilter,bfs:true, filterStartNode:false, limit:-1, optional:false, endNodes:[], terminatorNodes:[], sequence, beginSequenceAtStart:true}) yield node - expand the subgraph nodes reachable from start node following relationships to max-level adhering to the label filters

column1: apoc.path.combine(path1, path2) - combines the paths into one if the connecting node matches
apoc.path.create(startNode,[rels]) - creates a path instance of the given elements
apoc.path.elements(path) - returns a list of node-relationship-node-...
apoc.path.slice(path, [offset], [length]) - creates a sub-path with the given offset and length
